articles.title: How to Reset Your Password
articles.content:
Password Reset Procedure

If you've forgotten your password or need to reset it for security reasons, follow these steps:

Method 1: Self-Service Portal

  1. Navigate to the Self-Service Portal at portal.company.com
  2. Click on "Forgot Password"
  3. Enter your username or email address
  4. Check your email for a password reset link
  5. Click the link and create a new password

Method 2: Contact Service Desk

If you cannot access the self-service portal, contact the Service Desk:

  • Phone: 1-800-HELP
  • Email: servicedesk@company.com
  • Chat: Available 24/7

Password Requirements

Your new password must meet these requirements:

  • At least 12 characters long
  • Include uppercase and lowercase letters
  • Include at least one number
  • Include at least one special character
  • Cannot be a previously used password
Note: Passwords expire every 90 days. You will receive a reminder 14 days before expiration.
articles.excerpt: Step-by-step guide for resetting your password using the self-service portal or contacting the Service Desk.

articles.title: VPN Connection Troubleshooting Guide
articles.content:
VPN Troubleshooting

This guide helps resolve common VPN connectivity issues.

Common Issues and Solutions

Issue 1: Cannot Connect to VPN

Symptoms: VPN client shows "Connection Failed" or times out

Solutions:

  1. Verify your internet connection is working
  2. Check that you're using the correct VPN server address
  3. Ensure your credentials are correct
  4. Try disconnecting and reconnecting
  5. Restart the VPN client application

Issue 2: Connected but No Network Access

Symptoms: VPN shows connected but cannot access internal resources

Solutions:

  1. Check DNS settings are configured correctly
  2. Verify split tunneling is configured properly
  3. Try accessing resources by IP address instead of hostname
  4. Contact network team if issue persists

Issue 3: Slow VPN Performance

Symptoms: Applications are slow or unresponsive over VPN

Solutions:

  • Try a different VPN server closer to your location
  • Close bandwidth-heavy applications
  • Check your home network speed
  • Use wired connection instead of WiFi if possible

Escalation

If these steps don't resolve your issue, create an incident ticket with:

  • Error messages received
  • Steps already attempted
  • Your location and network details

articles.title: Incident Priority Matrix
articles.content:
Understanding Incident Priorities

This article explains how incidents are prioritized and the expected response times for each priority level.

Priority Levels

PriorityImpactUrgencyResponse TimeResolution Target
P1 - CriticalEnterprise-wideImmediate15 minutes4 hours
P2 - HighDepartment-wideHigh30 minutes8 hours
P3 - MediumLimited usersMedium2 hours24 hours
P4 - LowSingle userLow4 hours72 hours

Priority Determination

Priority is determined by combining Impact and Urgency:

  • Impact: How many users/services are affected
  • Urgency: How critical is the affected service

Examples

P1 Examples:

  • Email system down for entire organization
  • Critical production application unavailable
  • Security breach detected

P2 Examples:

  • Major application slow for department
  • Network outage affecting one building

P3 Examples:

  • Non-critical application issue for small team
  • Printer not working for multiple users

P4 Examples:

  • Single user cannot print
  • Request for software installation
articles.excerpt: Guide to understanding incident priority levels, response times, and how priorities are determined based on impact and urgency.

articles.title: How to Submit a Change Request
articles.content:
Change Request Process

All changes to production systems must go through the Change Management process. This ensures changes are properly reviewed, approved, and documented.

Types of Changes

  • Standard Changes: Pre-approved, low-risk changes (e.g., routine patching)
  • Normal Changes: Changes that require CAB review
  • Emergency Changes: Urgent changes to resolve critical incidents

Submitting a Change Request

  1. Log into the ITSM portal
  2. Navigate to Change Management â†’ New Change Request
  3. Fill in required fields:
    • Change Title and Description
    • Business Justification
    • Risk Assessment
    • Implementation Plan
    • Backout Plan
    • Testing Plan
  4. Attach any supporting documentation
  5. Submit for approval

Change Advisory Board (CAB)

Normal changes are reviewed weekly by the CAB. Meeting schedule:

  • Tuesdays: 10:00 AM - Infrastructure changes
  • Thursdays: 2:00 PM - Application changes

Lead Times

Change TypeMinimum Lead Time
Standard24 hours
Normal5 business days
EmergencyASAP (post-approval required)
